CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1953, pg. 2 reads: " 'Held for Federal Court - Alleged "pushers" and "junkies" nabbed during the recent Hill District narcotics dragnet found the going quite rough before United States Commissioner Harold Lavine last week and this week as they appeared before him on charges of having sold "junk" to Federal undercover agents. The agents' testimony included time, place, amount of dope and identification of the "pushers."  After discovering who one of the undercover agents was, some of the suspects plead guilty.  The rest were held for court on the basis of the damaging testimony and heavy bonds were imposed.  Left to right,  Commissioner Lavine, left, shows Atty. Albert (Al) Martin, counsel for some of the "dream taffy" and "illusion dust" set a copy of the charges brought against one of his clients by the United States Government...-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: United States Commissioner Harold Lavine, and Atty. Albert "Al" Martin reading a copy of charges against his clients in Pittsburgh Federal Courthouse
